extendedIngredients.original: In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar and black pepper. Set aside.

extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.original: At least… I think that's what he's trying to do. I usually flash a shy smile and rush off to the butter section where I can be left alone.
extendedIngredients.originalName: At least… I think that's what he's trying to do. I usually flash a shy smile and rush off to the butter section where I be left alone

extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.original: Except… wait! Just two days ago some dude was trying to chat me up about butter (yea, right) while I was standing there spacing out. I space out a lot in the grocery store.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Exce wait! Just two days ago some dude was trying to chat me up about butter (yea, right) while I was standing there spacing out. I space out a lot in the grocery store

extendedIngredients.name: egg
extendedIngredients.original: Maybe the egg section is safer for me. Maybe I should stop wearing lip gloss at the grocery store. Maybe I should wear more pantsuits.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Maybe the egg section is safer for me. Maybe I should stop wearing lip gloss at the grocery store. Maybe I should wear more pantsuits
meta: for me. maybe i should stop wearing lip gloss at the grocery store. maybe i should wear more pantsuits.

extendedIngredients.original: Cook up pasta, drain and rinse in cool water. Chop radishes, green onions, pickles and snap peas. Drain and crumble tuna.

extendedIngredients.original: Toss together the pasta, tuna, vegetables and sauce. Taste and add salt if necessary. This recipe is also delicious with small chunks of cheddar cheese.

title: Tuna Pasta Salad with Spinach and Radishes
summary: Tuna Pasta Salad with Spinach and Radishes might be just the main course you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains about 86g of protein, 79g of fat, and a total of 1625 calories. For $3.5 per serving, this recipe covers 63% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 8. 37 people were impressed by this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. If you have pickles, when, i dunno. i just need spinach…. and tunan is pretty nice… and while we're sitting around talking nice things, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the butter you could follow this main course with the Cinnamon Butter Cake as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 97%, this dish is awesome. Similar recipes include One Bowl Suppers: Tuna with Spinach, Potatoes and Radishes, Tuna Spinach Pasta, and Midnight Pasta with Tuna, Pancettan and Spinach.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
